WRITING.TEXT: Not to mention he's basically another Giroud, which we don't need
Didn't watch the second half, how was Jack?

Finishing 4th is a great accomplishment considering the caliber of teams that were in the tournament. But even with that, I still feel there is something to be desired. Our style of play was horrible in the tournament. We struggled to keep possession for more than 5 seconds at a time in some games and many players were wasteful with the ball. Going forward we looked terrible. However defensively I thought Brooks and Cameron were great. Over the next few months I'd like to see Klinsmann play the same defenders so that they can grow more as a unit, but keep switching up the midfield and attack so that we can figure out a combination of players that can put balls in the back of the net.
78 appearances for a 19 year old is insane

I wouldn't like to see Mertesacker leave because of his personality, but at the same time I would because he's becoming worse and worse as the years go on. I'd be devastated if Koscielny and Bellerin left as well.
Xhaka bottled it, already in the Arsenal mentality
Let's all just pretend that penalty didn't happen...
...and I thought American voters were idiots.
What about Isco? He's fallen out of favor in Madrid and is still young, I think he could do a job for us
Yes great idea, let's bring on another defender so that we can defend the lead that we don't have

I just don't understand the thought process in this lineup...against these teams we know that we can't keep possession so we have to take advantage of counter attacks. But no, let's put Wondolowski and Beckerman in so they can just take up space
I have German heritage so I'm supporting Germany, but I also really like watching Italy. Always had a thing for those Juventus defenders.
Between December and January we should have one loss at the most. We'll be looking good, sitting in first until February and March until we start losing easy games
25 mil? Please be true
Hasn't Coquelin gone in at RB before? I think he could fill in if he had to
Wonder if you'll be able to transfer or go on loan out of the BPL? Or maybe they'll release some kind of DLC for another league or something.
I'd want Milik but I'm not sure what he'd offer that Giroud doesn't. Besides him, definitely Glik, and obviously Lewa but there's no chance of getting him
I think either Ramsey, Wilshere, or Santi will move up and play on the wing. Can't waste that talent on the bench
I was referring to the one right after the counter attack where bale passed it to him and he dribbled around and eventually won a corner, but that one was impressive as well
Great corner too, put it right to the first man
That was pure luck, he wasn't trying to pass that ball. He lost his balance and took a large touch. He's been really bad all game
They scored from outside the box yesterday, so there's no way they can be compared to us
Can't believe a foul wasn't given on that Koscielny challenge
Essentially a mix of both of them. Does the dirty defensive work but also can supply long through balls.

Had a job interview last Thursday and they told me they'd call me back within a day. A week later and no call, so I went in the place and asked about why I didn't get a call. The manager said the owner had been really busy the past week and he'll call me soon. Must be extremely busy if he doesn't have 5 minutes to call me and tell me if I got the job or not.

As much as I'd like to see us go for Lacazette I just feel like he won't perform very well. He definitely offers something different for us because of his pace, but I'm not sure how well he can adjust. I think our best bet is to go for Janssen, although I could really see us bidding for Ben-Yedder as well
Why would we buy Lukaku when he's basically Giroud with a little more pace? We need someone who offers something different
If we changed to a two striker formation I think he'd do alright at striker, but I don't see wenger changing from the 4231
How is Zardes in the starting lineup? What exactly does he contribute that Pulisic or Nagbe don't?
*cough* Gibbs and Ox *cough*
Valid point, it seems like we don't ever have a plan, just pass it around and wait for a defender to make a mistake

WRITING.TITLE: Our Play Style
WRITING.TEXT: [removed]

The only way he's similar to Theo is in their pace. Vardy has aggression, he goes after the ball. Theo gets the ball and tries to hit a shot in between a crowd of defenders. Vardy also has good positioning, Theo doesn't really.

I'm very torn when it comes to this transfer. I think 20 mil is a bit excessive for a guy who's had one amazing season and nothing else. People think that he'll just pick up right where he left off when we really have no idea if that was just a fluke or not. But on the other hand this is a huge risk and I love to see Wenger finally take a risk. And Vardy could provide the finishing we so desperately need. I think he could bring a lot to the team if he can keep the form he had at Leicester this past season.
Arsenal Store USA stuff is all like that. I bought a sweatshirt from there and it was pretty poor quality.
I don't understand this at all

I'm glad we made a signing already, but I'm not sure how well Xhaka is going to do at the Emirates. I've seen a lot of people jump on the bandwagon already, but I'm not too sure. He seems like a distributor to me, like Cazorla but in a deeper role. I'm not sure if he's quick enough to do the defensive work that Coq has been doing, with his slide tackles and hawking wingers down. I'm not saying he will be bad, but I think we'll definitely have to change our play style around in order to accommodate him. I'm thinking Wilshere or Ramsey at DM and Cazorla on the left with Alexis moving back to the right could work well.
No, we have so many DM's now, plus he'd play a similar role to Coq. Don't see the point in splashing out money for him unless Coq were to leave

This is going to sound really weird but whatever
So as an American I was never really exposed to football/soccer. A couple of my friends played soccer so I knew a little bit but not a lot. They told me to get FIFA 14 when it came out so I did. I was really bad at the game so I tried using a bunch of fast players so I could score. I liked using Arsenal players like Walcott and Ox because they were fast. Then I started watching some games and fell in love with the play style and the beautiful passing, I just loved how they played (and we were top of the table for a while at the beginning of the 13/14 season, that probably played a role in it, not going to lie). I'm not sure how I got so passionate about Arsenal because I don't have any friends that are Arsenal supporters, but I've become more passionate about Arsenal than any other team that I support.

Lukaku would be great for us. He can play a similar role that Giroud now plays but would give us more options on the counter because of his pace, in addition to the fact that he's just now turned 23 and has proved that he's a good finisher. He's got quite a future ahead of him and I'd prefer if that future was at Arsenal
If Flam stays, Ozil stays
The confidence to shoot that ball too...this man is crazy. Although recently he's been a bit of a letdown, his good moments will always be remembered
He used to play wing when he played in Spain and he's played wing for us before too
Wonder what this means for Walcott...looks like he'll become second choice striker until Welbz gets back

Breakout: Preston Smith. The mans got huge talent as seen at the end of last season. Regress: Desean Jackson. He's getting older and we've got a lot of young guys coming up 6th Man: RJF. He's a leader and he's gotta be big for us if we have limited defensive line depth

I'd like to see santi play farther up the pitch for at least a few games
Santi--------------Ozil-----------Sanchez
Coq/Elneny--------Xhaka
I feel like Xhaka will play that distributor role that Santi was playing earlier this year. Wenger likes one of our DM's to be quick like coq or Elneny, and Xhaka isn't the quickest.

Ideally I'd want a major overhaul, getting rid of players who aren't performing like Ox, Walcott, Ramsey (debatable), Mertesacker, etc. and replace them with better options. At CB I'd like a tall, strong player like perhaps Koulibaly or even Howedes, someone like that. My preferred option in the midfield would be Xhaka, and I'd like to buy an attacking mid/winger (maybe Isco or Lucas as they've both fallen out of the starting eleven at their respective clubs). I'd also like us to buy a striker, someone consistent. Their are many choices in that department. This overhaul will redefine the teams mentality and turn us into winners.
Realistically we'll only sign Xhaka and send some players out on loan though
I can't see Jones playing that big of a role considering the receiving options we've got. I see us focusing primarily on passing this year, which would put Thompson in on passing downs.

WRITING.TITLE: Realistic Striker Signings
WRITING.TEXT: As we all know very well, we need a striker. Welbeck is looking like he's going to be a great super sub, but obviously isn't the quality that we need in order to compete for the title. Giroud can be fantastic on his day, but his goal droughts hurt us drastically. We need a consistent goal scorer, so who could you see us going for and why?
Definitely on the same page as you, but if Xhaka comes, then surely someone's on their way out, so who would that be?

We could potentially be losing a large chunk of our team this summer. Ozil has become insanely frustrated with his teammates, and we all saw Alexis storm off straight down the tunnel. Santi has been injured and is continuously aging. Wenger realizes we have younger talent to replace him. If this happens, he'll buy a replacement for Ozil, but not for Alexis and not for Cazorla. Wenger craves stability. He doesn't like to spend unless he knows the player will fit right in without having to change anything. Unless we can either retain these players or find good, solid replacements, we won't finish top 4. I hope it doesn't come to this and Wenger realizes that we actually need a striker who can score goals consistently and a solid centre back that can handle the pace of the BPL, but unless he buys big names then there's no way we finish in at least a respectable spot.
That being said, I'm sure Wenger realizes what is going on here. He is a smart man and he knows that certain players aren't performing to the standards that are acceptable at this club. I believe we will make signings and finish 2nd or 3rd next year with City winning it all.
United at home, City at home, last 30 minutes of Bayern at home, or 5-2 vs Leicester
Ozil is very frustrated with his teammates, a bit alarming
Guess we're just going to settle for mediocrity from now on then.

It's so frustrating. When you're in the box and you have a clear shot at goal, you shoot the fucking ball. We pack the box with players and try to pull some cheeky shit on a goal every fucking time. Just shoot the god damn ball

I really doubt we will get another defensive midfielder honestly. As much as I want one, we have Elneny, coq, wilshere, Ramsey, cazorla (if you consider him one), and flamini. Knowing wenger he won't sign anyone. I think we'll end up signing some striker from a mid table team from a top 5 league and possibly a centre back.

I just can't understand how this happened. The last minutes of the first half defined the game. You can't just defend solidly for a few more minutes? And I really wish our players would shoot when they are in space. I'm just sick and tired of the mediocrity at this club. No leaders, no one has that mentality "it's the 80th minute, I need to make a difference." It's just depressing honestly.
That was beautiful. I was so impressed with Elneny today, his passing was so great. Iwobi is showing so much promise, too
I really hope you're joking

But we all know we won't match their fight. Everyone from the ownership and management to a lot of the players are just striving to get a top 4 finish and don't really care about winning as long as they get paid. This has become a business and not a football club.
Positives- we are creating chances Negatives- NO ONE FUCKING FINISHES THEM
All I said was that he's leaving, he definitely is part of the problem though

No leaders, no finishing, this team is horrible. Wenger needs to go, Ozil and Alexis will go too. You put our best team out and you can't get a result in a home fixture against Watford? WATFORD! Major overhaul coming this summer because this club is going in the wrong direction. I'm shocked at the lack of ability in this team.

Typical Walcott, strings together 5 or so bad games then scores twice with an assist to make everyone think he's relevant. Anyways, that gift to Giroud will do wonders for his confidence and hopefully he'll be back to good form
We should be taking those chances, Giroud had an open goal but cannoned it off the crossbar. That's not unlucky, that's bad
I think Campbell has an effect on the whole team. Today we seemed to have much more urgency than we did against United. Poor finishing and defending is what let us down today

WRITING.TITLE: What is Wenger's problem with Campbell?
WRITING.TEXT: Could the board perhaps be forcing Wenger to play domestic players like Walcott, Ox, and Welbz over Campbell? I just don't understand, everyone else sees he's much better
I fully expect Ozil to leave this summer. He shouldn't be wasting his prime like this.

1. Mertesacker and Gabriel...How about instead of worrying about why the ref didn't call a foul you get back and play some fucking defence? 2. Giroud, what the fuck is wrong with you? 6 yard box and you hit the bar? A 6 year old could have made that 3. Bellerin, PLEASE learn how to cross the ball. I couldn't tell you how many crosses he had that didn't go past the first man 4. Monreal you need to learn how to use your right foot man 5. Arsene Wenger, have you gone insane? Take off arguably our best player so far this match for no reason? And then after conceding, you decide to take off one of our most threatening players for a man who touches the ball about 10-15 times a game? Yes we were extremely unlucky not to score more than 1 goal, but it's Swansea City, we shouldn't be blaming bad luck for not beating a relegation candidate. This is disturbing

If you look back two seasons, the only one that has really progressed has been Ramsey. Over the past two seasons he's gotten better. But the rest haven't really changed too much and I think time should be running out for them considering their recent performances (yes Walcott, I'm looking at you).
I'm sorry but you can't back Walcott. He literally does nothing when he's on the pitch, and then scores like once every couple games to make people think he's relevant.

We need to get rid of the dead weight and replace them with players who have some passion. Walcott definitely and there's even an argument for the likes of Wilshere and Ox. We need a consistent striker who's going to put the ball in the back of the net at a regular rate. And we need a CB and a DM who don't make stupid decisions. If these players are not bought then there's no way we can win the league. Mertesacker and Coq can both be brilliant on their day but they both make reckless decisions that end up costing us big time.

Walcott consistently does nothing game in and game out and then occasionally scores a goal, making everyone think he's vital to the team. But he isn't at all. I honestly do not understand why he is in the starting XI. He's constantly caught offsides, makes horrible runs and doesn't finish them, doesn't track back, and he constantly gives the ball away. If Arsene won't give Joel another shot then at least put Ramsey back up there. Something has to change
And you can see this mindset in almost every player during the games. Apart from Welbz and Ozil no one else was even trying.
I'd say send him on loan so he can get some more playing time, but we are so thin right now. Sign some players Arsene!

FUT takes a while to master, I suggest playing some offline tournaments first and maybe also using your draft token to play offline. When I first went into online I struggled to score, but once I learned that you have to finesse basically everything I got better. No matter how bad you might be at first though don't give up on it, just takes some getting used to.
